page.title: 02ALKHAM VILLAGE FETE
page.content: Alkham village holds an annual fete on Vicarage Meadow, or in Hogbrook Barn if the weather is inclement. This is organised by a special committee to include numerous stalls, displays and competitions. The money raised is divided between the Village Hall Improvement Fund and the Church Fabric Fund, this year's total exceeded Â£13OO. This year's fete took place on 6th July in brilliant sunshine. Crowds of villagers and people from miles around enjoyed displays by Dover Gymnastics Club and Squires School of Dancing and an exhibition of old vehicles by Dover Transport Museum Society. A flower and produce show took place in the Village Hall. Children took part in fancy dress competitions and sports events. Refreshments were served throughout.
